azurerm_container_group.description: Create as an Azure Container Group instance.

name.description: The name of the volume mount. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

container.description: The definition of a container that is part of the group as documented in the `container` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

os_type.description: The OS for the container group. Allowed values are `Linux` and `Windows`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

dns_name_label.description: The DNS label/name for the container groups IP. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

ip_address_type.description: Specifies the ip address type of the container. `Public` or `Private`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. If set to `Private`, `network_profile_id` also needs to be set.

network_profile_id.description: Network profile ID for deploying to virtual network.

image_registry_credential.description: A `image_registry_credential` block as documented below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

restart_policy.description: Restart policy for the container group. Allowed values are `Always`, `Never`, `OnFailure`. Defaults to `Always`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

type.description: The Managed Service Identity Type of this container group. Possible values are `SystemAssigned` (where Azure will generate a Service Principal for you), `UserAssigned` where you can specify the Service Principal IDs in the `identity_ids` field, and `SystemAssigned, UserAssigned` which assigns both a system managed identity as well as the specified user assigned identities. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

identity_ids.description: Specifies a list of user managed identity ids to be assigned. Required if `type` is `UserAssigned`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

image.description: The container image name. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

cpu.description: The required number of CPU cores of the containers. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

memory.description: The required memory of the containers in GB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

gpu.description: A `gpu` block as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

ports.description: A set of public ports for the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Set as documented in the `ports` block below.

environment_variables.description: A list of environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

secure_environment_variables.description: A list of sensitive environment variables to be set on the container. Specified as a map of name/value pairs. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

readiness_probe.description: The definition of a readiness probe for this container as documented in the `readiness_probe` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

liveness_probe.description: The definition of a readiness probe for this container as documented in the `liveness_probe` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

commands.description: A list of commands which should be run on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

volume.description: The definition of a volume mount for this container as documented in the `volume` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

log_analytics.description: A `log_analytics` block as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

username.description: The username with which to connect to the registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

password.description: The password with which to connect to the registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

server.description: The address to use to connect to the registry without protocol ("https"/"http"). For example: "myacr.acr.io". Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

log_type.description: The log type which should be used. Possible values are `ContainerInsights` and `ContainerInstanceLogs`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

workspace_id.description: The Workspace ID of the Log Analytics Workspace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

workspace_key.description: The Workspace Key of the Log Analytics Workspace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

metadata.description: Any metadata required for Log Analytics. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

port.description: Number of the port to access on the container. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

protocol.description: The network protocol associated with port. Possible values are `TCP` & `UDP`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

count.description: The number of GPUs which should be assigned to this container. Allowed values are `1`, `2`, or `4`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

sku.description: The Sku which should be used for the GPU. Possible values are `K80`, `P100`, or `V100`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

mount_path.description: The path on which this volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

read_only.description: Specify if the volume is to be mounted as read only or not. The default value is `false`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

storage_account_name.description: The Azure storage account from which the volume is to be mounted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

storage_account_key.description: The access key for the Azure Storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

share_name.description: The Azure storage share that is to be mounted as a volume. This must be created on the storage account specified as above. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

exec.description: Commands to be run to validate container readiness. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

http_get.description: The definition of the httpget for this container as documented in the `httpget` block below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

initial_delay_seconds.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness or readiness probes are initiated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

failure_threshold.description: How many times to try the probe before restarting the container (liveness probe

success_threshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. The default value is `1` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

timeout_seconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. The default value is `1` and the minimum value is `1`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

path.description: Path to access on the HTTP server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

scheme.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Possible values are `Http` and `Https`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

id.description: The ID of the Container Group.

ip_address.description: The IP address allocated to the container group.

fqdn.description: The FQDN of the container group derived from `dns_name_label`.

create.description: Used when creating the Container Group.

update.description: Used when updating the Container Group.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Container Group.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Container Group.
